subject: Re: [junit] assert
msgSnippet: A few issues: 1) the original mail was about Testing EJB .  Do not ask a totally different question when answering to a news.  Write a new mail instead. ...
messageBody:
A few issues:

1) the original mail was about "Testing EJB". Do not ask a totally different question when answering to a news. Write a new mail instead.

> Can I check assert with boolean values.
> assertEquals(boolean,boolean) instead of using standard string values

2) an API is provided (all the information can be found in the class junit.framework.Assert).

3) answer:

assertEquals(String, Boolean, Boolean);
assertEquals(Boolean, Boolean);
assertTrue(boolean == boolean);
assertTrue(String, boolean == boolean);

4) Yes you can use assert(boolean == boolean) but this method is deprecated in the version 3.7 :-)

-Vladimir
